image.altText: A man stands between two ceremonial poles

props.synopsis: The family of vanished Yolŋu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.

title.children: Vanished Aboriginal leader's family call for probe into alleged killer

image.altText: A group of colourful eggs sit in a basket on grass.

props.synopsis: Compulsory super has led to higher levels of national savings, but, as the pool of savings grows, many argue that stricter supervision is needed to protect Australians' retirement savings.

title.children: Up to 30,000 people at risk of losing some or all their super, ASIC boss warns

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: The military says it is ready to mobilise as Donald Trump authorises "full force" to protect federal immigration facilities from "domestic terrorists".

title.children: Trump to deploy troops to 'war-ravaged' Portland, ICE facilities

image.altText: Sergey Lavrov stands at lectern with UN symbol on the front

props.synopsis: While Russia does not intend to attack Europe, its Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has not ruled out action against NATO aggression.

title.children: Russian minister warns NATO any aggression will be met with a 'decisive response'

image.altText: Harris Andrews, Chris Fagan and Lachie Neale hold up the AFL premiership trophy.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan admits he took a punt by naming Lachie Neale as the sub ahead of their stunning win over Geelong in the grand final.

title.children: How Fagan avoided looking 'like a total idiot' with inspired Neale sub call

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron crouched and nursing an arm injury during the Cats' AFL grand final against the Lions.

props.synopsis: It is the cruel irony of sport that what is usually the ace up Geelong's sleeve proved to be its downfall in the loss to the Brisbane Lions in the season decider.

title.children: Geelong's superpower fails its biggest test against Brisbane juggernaut

image.altText: An older woman holding a cup of tea at a table.

props.synopsis: Jindabyne is grappling with how to capitalise on its winter tourism influx while ensuring long-term residents can continue to afford to live there.

title.children: Snow town struggles as high housing prices force residents out

image.altText: King Charles and Anthony Albanese standing beside one another in suits in an ornate sitting room with two patterned lounges

props.synopsis: King Charles III has received Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in a royal audience held at Balmoral Castle in Scotland.

title.children: Albanese meets with King Charles at Balmoral

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a abandoned building

props.synopsis: China's presence in the Pacific is often viewed in the context of geopolitical tension and rivalry. But Chinese people have been in the region for generations — these are their stories.

title.children: 'To eat bitterness': In the Pacific, there is 'old' Chinese and 'new' Chinese

image.altText: People walking arounda  rubble, looking through damage and debris after a military strike.

props.synopsis: Israeli strikes and gunfire have killed at least 59 people across Gaza in the past day, according to health officials.

title.children: No word on Donald Trump's Israel-Gaza ceasefire plan, says Hamas

image.altText: Guy Sebastian is seated, smiling. He wears a black blazer with a white outline.

props.synopsis: Guy Sebastian opens up about the fan encounter that made him "burst into tears" and a court case with his former manager, Titus Day.

title.children: Guy Sebastian's 'deep shame' over fan encounter

props.synopsis: Exclusive data for 5.2 million couples shows nearly one in five marriages are between people of different religions – double the proportion recorded in 1986.

title.children: The group that's almost everyone's top pick for love, according to the data

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: The grump's back to take on the grommets in a new series of Hard Quiz Kids. Don't let the pint-sized know-it-alls show you up.

title.children: It's time to put Australia's pint-sized hot shots in their place. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A graphic of a Sydney terrace area in the background with three black and white mug shots in the middle of crims.

props.synopsis: From the "queen of the underworld" to a razor gang slasher in control of an underworld empire, these were the bosses at the centre of an organised crime battle in the late 20s and early 30s.

title.children: The crime bosses who wreaked havoc on Sydney a century ago

image.altText: a kid holds a broken surfboard

props.synopsis: Bowie Daly may be back in the surf but he says the near miss still plays on his mind.

title.children: Nine-year-old surfer returns to the water weeks after shark attack

image.altText: Patches of snow on a mountain

props.synopsis: A group of tourists who were unprepared for the extreme conditions at Cradle Mountain National Park is rescued, but one member of the group dies.

title.children: Walker dies after group 'overwhelmed' by extreme weather at Cradle Mountain

image.altText: a boy in cowboy hat and shirt in front of trees

props.synopsis: In a huge dark hat and shining belt buckle, a 10-year-old from Cape York proves he can mix it with the best at the world finals in Utah.

title.children: Small bull rider with a 'big heart' takes on the world's best

image.altText: Liam and Noel Gallagher pose in shirt and white jacket respectively against beige backdrop

props.synopsis: They'll soon tour Australia, but 30 years ago, Oasis were about to release (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — an enduring British rock classic. Here's how they did it.

title.children: Oasis's 'biblical' reunion is largely thanks to this blockbuster album

image.altText: A bob cat in front of a very large pile of coal

props.synopsis: Despite a change of government, Queensland's controversial coal royalty scheme remains in place and recent job cuts are prompting renewed discussion about it.

title.children: Queensland's 'golden goose' coal royalty regime questioned again

image.altText: A man sitting in front of a beachfront, looking into the distance pensive, with an island behind him in the distance.

props.synopsis: More First Nations remains are being returned to Australia from international institutions, but these Woppaburra men say laying them to rest on country can prove a fresh challenge.

title.children: Stolen and bombed ancestral remains face final repatriation hurdle

image.altText: England players Natasha Hunt and Zoe Aldcroft celebrate with the Women's Rugby World Cup.

props.synopsis: In front of a record crowd of more than 80,000 spectators, England delivers on the biggest stage with a 33-13 defeat of Canada in the tournament decider at Twickenham.

title.children: England wins third Women's Rugby World Cup after defeating Canada in final

image.altText: Cam Roigard celebrates

props.synopsis: The All Blacks have beaten the Wallabies 33-24 at Eden Park, extending their 39-year and counting winning record against Australia at the Auckland venue.

title.children: Wallabies fall just short as ex-player launches tirade against referee

image.altText: Jocelyn Kelleher of the Roosters kicks during the NRLW preliminary final.

props.synopsis: Jocelyn Kelleher is relishing the chance to prove her credentials as the Sydney Roosters look to claim back-to-back premierships for the first time in their history.

title.children: Kelleher desperate to help Roosters complete unbeaten NRLW season

image.altText: A dark-coloured feral pig on some grass near a patch of mud.

props.synopsis: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

title.children: Feral pigs found in SA were imported illegally from NSW, testing shows

image.altText: Janelle Noble and Rod Barwick walk among a field of daffodils.

props.synopsis: Rod Barwick planted his first daffodil bulbs in the 1970s. Within a few years he was breeding daffodils and has been recognised internationally for his work, but he says enjoying growing plants is the most important part of gardening.

title.children: A daffodil cross that 'wasn't meant to be achieved' made Rod Barwick famous

image.altText: A woman with short, curly grey hair stands next to a box planter pouring water from a green watering can.

props.synopsis: Dead sea life washed ashore during SA's marine algal bloom has been diverted into commercial compost for farms and gardens, in what has been viewed as a small win amid the large-scale devastation.

title.children: Algal bloom sea casualties find new life in commercial compost

image.altText: Charlie Cameron roars during the 2025 AFL grand final

props.synopsis: Brisbane completed an historic back-to-back premiership, beating a wounded Geelong at the MCG, and the internet followed along with every kick.

title.children: How the internet reacted to Brisbane winning the AFL grand final

image.altText: Jodie Haydon, Anthony Albanese, Donald Trump gives a thumbs-up and Melania Trump all smiling in front of a blue curtain.

props.synopsis: A photo of a smiling Donald Trump, alongside Anthony Albanese, his fiancée Jodie Haydon and US First Lady Melania Trump, has been released by the White House.

title.children: Thumbs up from Trump, as White House releases official photo with Albanese

image.altText: A photo of the front of the Moruya Airport.

props.synopsis: The pilot of a light plane dies following a successful sky-diving drop when the aircraft crashes into bushland on the NSW south coast.

title.children: Pilot dies in plane crash after skydiving flight in Moruya

image.altText: A pinboard with black and white pictures of Frank.N.Furter  dressed up in fishnet stockings and one sitting on dining table.

props.synopsis: The Rocky Horror Picture Show film still screens in cinemas around the world, captivating a new generation of cinemagoers.

title.children: Rocky Horror at 50 is still a home for misfits and dreamers

image.altText: Clive Palmer NPC address

props.synopsis: The decade-long dispute was related to WA government legislation, which impeded Clive Palmer's ability to extract damages over the Balmoral South Iron Ore Project in the Pilbara.

title.children: Palmer ordered to pay more than $13m after foreign investor claim dismissed

image.altText: Two police cars on a city street at night, sirens blazing

props.synopsis: A woman has suffered life-threatening injuries after being hit by a vehicle during an alleged car theft on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Three teenagers arrested after woman hit by stolen car

image.altText: A close-up side profile of a man with thick brown hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's lawyers have revealed the five grounds they are seeking to appeal their client's guilty verdict on, including an allegation that the judge made an "impermissible comment to the jury".

title.children: Matt Wright's five grounds of appeal include allegation against judge

image.altText: The Victoria Police crest, badge, on the arm of an officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: Homicide Squad detectives are investigating the death of a man in Victoria's east in an incident that left another man seriously injured.

title.children: One man dead, another seriously injured in Victoria's east

image.altText: A close up of Andrew Hastie against a blue curtain.

props.synopsis: The West Australian veteran has a clear vision for the future of the Liberal Party — and he's making it known.

title.children: Andrew Hastie wants to be Liberal leader. The question is when
